Sentence.sentence: A year on, the meetings have made lasting changes to what she throws away in her kitchen.

Sentence.sentence: This level of wastage is a tragedy that cannot continue if we are to succeed in the challenge of sustainably meeting our future food demands.

Sentence.sentence: Major supermarkets, in meeting consumer expectations, will often reject entire crops of perfectly edible fruit and vegetables at the farm because they do not meet exacting marketing standards for their physical characteristics, such as size and appearance
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: At office meetings and in group discussions, they might speak up more often, express strong opinions and come up with more creative and practical ideas than their male colleagues.

Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"会，会议"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: conference, congress, assembly, meeting, rally, council, session, convention, gathering
means: conference ： 正式用词，一般指大型会议，如政府工作会议、国际学术交流会议、各国之间的协商、会谈等。
congress ： 指国会、议会、代表大会等机构，尤指经选举产生的国家立法机构的大会或由这些机构召开的大会，也可指专业人员代表大会。
assembly ： 多指一个通常有许多人参加、计划好的，为某一特殊目的而召集的会议。
meeting ： 普通用词，词义广泛。指一般性的会议，可用于任何场合。
rally ： 指大规模的群众性政治集会。
council ： 在国际上多指由各国代表参加的政治会议，或常设的政治机构。在国内、地方上，此词多指常设的政务领导机构，如市政委员会等。
session ： 一般指议会等召开的正式会议。
convention ： 侧重指某一政党或团体为某一特殊目的而召开的会议；也可指学术团体的年会。
gathering ： 指两人以上的聚会或集会，强调非正式性。

means.word_mean: 相会, 聚会, 会见

sentences.en: It was an accidental meeting.
sentences.cn: 这完全是一次偶然的相会。

sentences.en: We have two meetings in London.
sentences.cn: 我们在伦敦有两次聚会。

sentences.en: He spoke at the meeting in a bright voice.
sentences.cn: 他在会上大声地发言。

sentences.en: They talked in the meeting.
sentences.cn: 他们在会议期间私下谈话。

sentences.en: What has the meeting decided?
sentences.cn: 与会者做出了什么决定?

sentences.en: There is a sports meeting next week.
sentences.cn: 下周有一场运动会。</seg>

jx.jx_en_mean: an understanding or agreement between people

entry.def: A meeting is an event in which a group of people come together to discuss things or make decisions.

example.ex: Can we have a meeting to discuss that?
example.tran: 我们可以开会来讨论那件事吗？

entry.def: When you meet someone, either by chance or by arrangement, you can refer to this event as a meeting .

example.ex: In January, 37 years after our first meeting, I was back in the studio with Denis...
example.tran: 那是1月，在我们初次相遇37年之后，我和丹尼斯一同回到了工作室。

example.ex: Her life was changed by a chance meeting with her former art master a few years ago.
example.tran: 她的生活因几年前同她以前的美术老师的偶遇改变了。

sentences.sentence: "next year the meeting will be in Chicago"

means.word_mean: 2. the social act of assembling for some common purpose;

sentences.sentence: "his meeting with the salesmen was the high point of his day"
"there was an informal meeting in my livingroom"
"he still remembers their meeting in Paris"
"there was a brief encounter in the hallway"

means.word_mean: 5. the act of joining together as one;

sentences.sentence: "the merging of the two groups occurred quickly"

means.word_mean: 6. a place where things merge or flow together (especially rivers);

sentences.sentence: "Pittsburgh is located at the confluence of the Allegheny and Monongahela rivers"

sentences.cn: 他在三月份与来自二十国集团成员国的环境和能源部长们举行圆桌会议，他在会上的演讲可以追溯到1972 年在斯德哥尔摩召开的联合国人类环境会议。

sentences.cn: 近期我参加了几个会议，讨论留住学生、防止年轻教员流失的方法。
sentences.en: Recently I attended several meetings where we talked about ways to retain students and keep younger faculty members from going elsewhere.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 作为任教于三所不同的大学的教授，我注意到关于教育年轻人和年龄较大的学生的真正问题已经恶化，然而受聘人员——不是为了教学而是为了组织会议——的数量急剧增加。
sentences.en: And in my position as a professor at three different colleges, the actual problems in educating our young people and older students have deepened, while the number of people hired—not to teach but to hold meetings—has increased significantly.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 管理松懈的团队是滋生混乱的温床——员工常常抱怨开会占用了太多时间，或者办公室环境嘈杂，使得他们没法完成工作。
sentences.en: Loosely managed teams can become hotbeds of distraction—employees routinely complain that they can’t get their work done because they are forced to spend too much time in meetings or compelled to work in noisy offices.

Sentence.sentence: Loosely managed teams can become hotbeds of distraction—employees routinely complain that they can't get their work done because they are forced to spend too much time in meetings or compelled to work in noisy offices.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Recently I attended several meetings where we talked about ways to retain students and keep younger faculty members from going elsewhere.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I offer a simple proposition in response: Many of our problems—class attendance, educational success, student happiness and well-being—might be improved by cutting down the bureaucratic ( ' ,  官僚的) mechanisms and meetings and instead hiring an army of good teachers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Cutting down meetings and encouraging administrative staff to go to classrooms.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And in my position as a professor at three different colleges, the actual problems in educating our young people and older students have deepened, while the number of people hired—not to teach but to hold meetings—has increased significantly.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文
